definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Therefore, it is suggested that there is a great potential for the ore-search inYongmeihui metallogenic area.
sentences.chinese: 通過對比表明，永海會地區具有極大的找礦前應景。

sentences.english: Moreover, the film's powerful cast is entirely a product of the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 更何況影片超強的演員陣容完全是應景產物。

sentences.english: In addition to moon cake, some popular fruit Asians eat on Moon Festival are pomelo and star fruit.
sentences.chinese: 除了月餅之外亞洲人常喫的應景水果就是柚子與楊桃。

sentences.english: With the increasing heated economics soar, China fever has become more and more to the world's sight.
sentences.chinese: 隨着中國經濟的急速升溫，中國熱自然而然應景而生。

definition: (of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
ecstasy/rapture/to feel overwhelming joy or sorrow
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
aggrieved/dejected/(Tw, southern China) to be moved by a kind gesture etc/to feel gratified/to feel warm inside
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
